page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: There are 21 farms and 3 market gardens in our area. 7 farmers have a milk quota, one produces only eggs, the rest grow wheat, barley and potatoes, and keep sheep and beef cattle. Most own their own farms which are mainly under 250 acres. Two farms are over 500 acres. The dairy farmers grow fodder, beet and most make silage to feed to the cattle in winter. On the three market gardens, only one man works full time; the others have jobs as well. Lots of the Chartist Bungalows have 2 or 3 acres and many people keep hens, goats and a few beef cattle but they do other jobs as well. There are also other small holdings of between 5 and 20 acres but the owners all do other jobs. Some people keep bees.
